law.catch_line: The bylaws may provide for the division of the territory served or to be served by a cooperative int...

text.section: The bylaws may provide for the division of the territory served or to be served by a cooperative into two or more districts for any purpose, including the nomination and election of directors.

If the bylaws provide for districts, the bylaws shall establish:
The boundaries of the districts or the manner of establishing the boundaries;
The manner of changing the boundaries; and
The manner in which the districts shall function.
A member may not vote by proxy or by mail at a district meeting.
